metadata.title: CVE-2023-52878 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: can:dev: can_put_echo_skb(): don't crash kernel if can_priv::echo_skb isaccessed out of bounds If the "struct can_priv::echoo_skb" is accessed outof bounds, this would cause a kernel crash. Instead, issue a meaningfulwarning message and return with an error.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
